message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product. It's worth $150 to you, but I'm willing to sell it to you for $135. This is a great opportunity to get a valuable item at a reasonable price. Let me know if you're interested!
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $125. I'm willing to make a reasonable offer, but I'm not willing to go above that price.

Thank you for your interest in our product, Bob. I appreciate your offer, but I need to maintain a minimum price to ensure profitability. I am willing to consider $130 for the product. Please let me know if this works for you.
I'm still interested in the product, but I'm not willing to go up to $130. I'm willing to meet you in the middle at $127.50. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

I understand your position, Bob. Considering the value you place on the product, I believe we can reach an agreement closer to my initial offer. I am willing to sell the product for $129.50. This allows us both to feel satisfied with the transaction.
I appreciate your flexibility, Alice, but I'm still trying to get the best deal possible. I'm willing to meet you at $128. Would you be willing to accept that price?

I'm glad we're making progress, Bob. I'm willing to sell the product for $128.50. This price reflects the value of the product while ensuring a reasonable profit for me. I hope this meets your expectations.
I'm close to accepting, but I'm still trying to get the best deal. I'm willing to meet you at $128. I'm not willing to go any higher, so this is my final offer.
